As of the 2006 census the population of the urban area was 11,871. There were approximately 4,500 more people living in the surrounding rural area. The urban area has seen a growth rate of over 10% in the last five years, while the rural areas have seen population growth in excess of 25%.

Rangiora has not been unscathed from the recent Christchurch earthquakes and a few parts still remain to be fixed.

Over the next 10 years the council estimated the population of the Waimakariri district would swell by 25 per cent to 60,000. 

Rangiora has seen exponential growth since the 2011 Christchurch earthquake, this has pushed a lot more people out to Rangiora. Rangiora is also very popular with people migrating from the U.K.

The highest official temperature ever recorded in New Zealand was 42.4째C (108.3째F) at Rangiora on 7 February 1973.
The weather is usually 1 degree hotter than Christchurch City.
